title: Urban Flood Warning (Medium)
intro: Heavy rainfall is forecast. Drains already overflowing near your street. You have 30 minutes before water may enter ground floors.

steps.question: You receive an official flood alert. What do you do first?

options.label: Check gov/municipal updates & evacuation routes
options.explain: Trusted info first reduces panic & misinformation.

options.label: Post on social media asking friends what to do
options.explain: Might help later, but slow and unreliable at start.

options.label: Ignore & continue as usual

steps.question: Water starts pooling. What’s your immediate action?

options.label: Turn off mains electricity & move essentials upstairs
Drive your car out right now through water
options.explain: Flooded roads are unpredictable; risk of stalling/stranding.

options.label: Wait for a neighbour to coordinate
options.explain: Coordination is good, but act on safety first.

steps.question: Evacuation is advised in your zone. Choose:

options.label: Grab go‑bag (IDs, meds, water) & take recommended route
Take the shortest alley you know (not on the map)
Stay put; wait it out on ground floor

outcomes.title: Prepared
outcomes.message: You made timely choices and reduced risk for you & others.

outcomes.title: At Risk
outcomes.message: Mixed decisions. Improve speed & verify official routes.

title: Heatwave Advisory (High)
intro: A severe heatwave is forecast for 72 hours. Grid is under stress. Dehydration & heatstroke risks rising.

options.label: Plan hydration schedule & check on vulnerable neighbours
Close all windows and run AC at lowest temp all day
Go for an afternoon run to ‘adapt’

steps.question: Midday outage hits. What’s your move?

options.label: Use passive cooling (shades, damp cloth, ventilate in evening)
Sit in a parked car with AC on for hours
Ignore the heat; continue screen time
Water, ORS, light meals; avoid caffeine/alcohol
Energy drinks & spicy fried food
Nothing needed; ‘mind over matter’

outcomes.title: Moderate
outcomes.message: Some good choices; refine hydration & cooling.

title: Earthquake: Strong Shaking Expected
intro: A 6.8 quake has struck nearby. Shaking has stopped, but strong aftershocks are possible. Elevators and some stairwells may be unsafe.

options.label: Check for gas leaks, turn off gas/electric if damaged
Use the elevator to get down quickly
Run into the street without checking debris
options.explain: Falling glass/objects outside can be dangerous.

steps.question: You need to evacuate your building:

options.label: Take stairs; avoid walls/windows; cover head
Wait on a balcony for help
Grab heavy items first (TV, PC)

steps.question: Outside in a safe open area:

options.label: Check injuries, apply basic first aid, conserve phone battery
Re-enter building to search belongings
Drive around to survey damage
options.explain: Roads must be clear for emergency vehicles.

outcomes.title: Safe & Smart
outcomes.message: You minimized risks during and after the quake.

outcomes.title: Cautious
outcomes.message: Decent response; avoid re-entering risky structures.

outcomes.title: High Risk
outcomes.message: Choices exposed you to serious hazards.

title: Wildfire Encroaching (Medium)
intro: A wildfire has been reported 6 km away. Winds may push embers toward your neighbourhood within hours.

options.label: Clear dry leaves near home; seal vents; prep go‑bag
options.explain: Reduces ember ignition; prepares for move.

options.label: Spray entire roof for hours immediately
options.explain: May waste water; not always effective this early.

options.label: Do nothing until flames are visible
Plan route away from fire line; keep car fuelled; notify neighbours
Wait for a friend to confirm on Instagram
Start a small back-burn yourself
options.explain: Extremely dangerous and illegal in many places.

options.label: Use masks, stay low indoors or evacuate early via safe route
options.explain: Minimizes smoke inhalation; avoids last-minute rush.

options.label: Drive toward the ridge for a closer look
options.explain: Road closures and sudden fire shifts are deadly.

options.label: Ignore; windows open for 'fresh air'

outcomes.title: Proactive
outcomes.message: You reduced ignition risks and planned smartly.

outcomes.title: Borderline
outcomes.message: Some good calls; act earlier on evacuation planning.

outcomes.title: Endangered
outcomes.message: Choices increased exposure to fire and smoke.

title: City‑Wide Cyber Blackout
kicker: Critical systems disrupted • ATMs & mobile data down
intro: A cyberattack has disrupted power, banking, and cellular data in parts of the city. Misinformation and panic buying are spreading.

options.label: Conserve battery; verify info via radio/official SMS; avoid panic buys
Share unverified rumours to warn others
Drive city-wide to find working ATM

steps.question: Payments are unreliable; shops only take cash:

options.label: Prioritize essentials; coordinate with neighbours; keep receipts
Withdraw as much cash as possible and hoard
Argue with shopkeepers about prices loudly
Report cyber incidents; change passwords; enable 2FA
Reuse same passwords; click 'update link' from unknown SMS
Publicly post your OTP method to 'educate friends'

outcomes.title: Digitally Resilient
outcomes.message: You minimized chaos and improved cyber hygiene.

outcomes.title: Manageable
outcomes.message: Some good choices; improve info verification.

title: Emerging Pandemic: Local Cluster
intro: A contagious respiratory illness is spreading. Cases are rising in your district. Supplies and hospital beds are tight.

options.label: Isolate symptomatic member; mask indoors; call helpline
Host a small gathering since 'it’s just a cold'
Self‑medicate randomly; avoid testing
Use delivery if possible; contactless pickup; plan 2‑week essentials
Daily trips to crowded market for 'freshness'
Buy all masks/meds you can find
Follow public health advisories; verify sources; support vulnerable
Share 'miracle cures' and anti‑mask posts
Visit crowded celebrations to 'boost morale'

outcomes.title: Public‑Health Ally
outcomes.message: Smart isolation, planning, and verified info.

outcomes.title: Mixed Response
outcomes.message: Improve sourcing, testing, and crowd avoidance.

outcomes.title: High Transmission Risk
outcomes.message: Choices contribute to spread and strain on care.
